title: Can we reconsider Urgot?
body:
It has been a very long time since Urgot was first created and in that state of the game he came into his ability to be a bruiser-adc-mage broke the game so he was nerfed into oblivion and he has stayed there ever since aside from poking his head up for air once or twice. But does his kit even do that anymore?

There are plenty of champions with more overloaded kits then Urgot so whey don't we add a champion to this game by buffing him to playable?

Want to harass the top lane tanks and then build bruiser in the midgame? {{champion:126}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:114}}  already do that
Want to build half a few damage items and then tank while still melting squishies?{{champion:107}} {{champion:157}}  got it covered
Want to build tear and stack up with quick un-dodgable harass after landing one ability?{{champion:69}}  says "hi"

His kit isn't overly simple. Several of his abilities are skillshots and his ultimate has plenty of counterplay on it. He also isn't a feast or famine champ like some of the other perma-nerfed champions.

I don't think the game is in the same state it was when riot made the decision to nerf him out of it and I don't think that he needs to be reworked in order to be brought back into this game.

It's 2017 guys. Lets bring Urgot back into the game.

replies.body:
Urgot's design is very flawed to begin with.
He's supposed to be an AD caster that does good DPS which sounds stupid when ADCs can do that with basic attacks from further range as well.

They need to rethink Urgot's kit.

> [{quoted}](name=PPPPPPPPPPPP270,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g7iEmphX,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-01-24T18:13:20.122+0000)
>
> Urgot's design is very flawed to begin with.
> He's supposed to be an AD caster that does good DPS which sounds stupid when ADCs can do that with basic attacks from further range as well.
> 
> They need to rethink Urgot's kit.

His Q, his main source of damage, has a 0.85 bonus AD scaling. Meanwhile, Ezreal's Q has a 1.2 total AD scaling, lowers his cooldowns, and has higher range. 

There's a reason urgot isn't that popular.
urgot Q can be made unavoidable

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g7iEmphX,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2017-01-24T18:29:13.867+0000)
>
> urgot Q can be made unavoidable

Sure it can. But dealing 2/3rds the damage because you can occasionally make it lock on doesn't make him good. Not to mention ezreal's Q can proc on hits, like triforce. It's safe to say with that included ezreal's Q dps is over double that of Urgot's, all because Urgot can lock on to a target.

and because Urgot has a shield, % damage reduction towards himself, and damage reduction on his ult, not to mention he has armor shred and a permaslow while his shield is active 

urgot gets extremely tanky after he acquires a few items; there's no reason he should match Ezreal's DPS.

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g7iEmphX,comment-id=00020001000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-25T17:29:06.687+0000)

> 
> urgot gets extremely tanky after he acquires a few items; there's no reason he should match Ezreal's DPS.

A) he needs to build defensive items to get tanky
B) he doesn't have a free flash
C) damage reduction on his ult is countered by him literally putting himself in the enemy team as a ranged dps.
D) he doesn't have free waveclear and execute from across the map.

Sinply put he's just worse in every way than ezreal.
